title: Aural set, Tibetan song - instrument and voice

content.description:
You will hear an excerpt from a Tibetan folk song for voice and plucked-string instrument. The excerpt can be diagrammed as follows.

The excerpt will be played four times. Before listening to the music for the first time, please read the questions.
content.question: In relation to the vocal line, the instrument provides

choices.label: a chordal accompaniment for the voice
an independent countermelody to the voice
a heterophonic doubling of the voice
an imitative counterpoint to the voice

content.answer: a heterophonic doubling of the voice

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.G: Use terms and symbols to describe aspects of musical design in performed music, including texture, timbre, and instrumentation, and expressive elements, including dynamics, articulation, and tempo.
